data_findings.finding: bbox3.cpp is a C++ optimizer with: Complex Number Vector Coordination, Fluid Dynamics, Hinge Pivot, Density Gradient Flow, Global Boundary Tension. Uses aggressive_repair for overlap resolution. Key parameters: -n (iterations), -r (rounds). Uses OpenMP for parallelization.

tree_packer_v21.cpp uses: Swap moves, Multi-angle restarts, Higher temperature SA, Backward propagation (bp.cpp). Key parameters: -n (iterations), -r (rounds). Uses squeeze, compaction, localSearch. bp.exe removes trees from larger configs to improve smaller ones.

Pre-optimized submissions available at /home/nonroot/snapshots/santa-2025/21116303805/code/preoptimized/santa-2025.csv with score ~70.676. Target is 68.919154. Gap of ~1.75 points requires fundamentally different approaches beyond micro-optimization.

Christmas tree is a 15-vertex polygon with: tip at (0, 0.8), trunk from y=0 to y=-0.2, width 0.15. Base width 0.7, mid width 0.4, top width 0.25. Greedy placement uses weighted angle distribution abs(sin(2*angle)) to place more trees in corners.

Key 2D packing techniques: No-fit polygon (NFP) for feasible positions, meta-heuristics (GA, SA), GFPack++ (attention-based gradient field learning), bottom-left placement heuristics, hybrid GA+LP. NFP pre-computes all feasible relative positions of two polygons.

web_research.query: What are the best techniques for 2D irregular polygon packing to minimize bounding box area?
web_research.finding:
Two‑dimensional irregular‑polygon packing is usually tackled with a mix of geometric preprocessing and combinatorial optimisation.  The most widely adopted “classic” pipelines first generate a **no‑fit polygon (NFP)** or an **envelope polygon** that captures the feasible relative positions of two pieces, then use a placement heuristic (e.g., bottom‑left, skyline) to build a layout inside a bounding box.  Variants of this pipeline include the **pixel‑based method** (which discretises shapes into a bitmap for fast overlap checks) and exact **mixed‑integer programming (MIP)** formulations for small instances ([frontiersin.org](https://www.frontiersin.org/journals/mechanical-engineering/articles/10.3389/fmech.2022.966691/full)).  Recent refinements such as an **improved sliding algorithm for generating NFPs** make the geometric stage faster and more accurate, directly reducing the final box area ([mdpi.com](https://www.mdpi.com/2227-7390/10/16/2941)).
